title: Topic
description: This schema defines the Topic entity. A topic is a feed into which message are published to by publishers and read from by consumers in a messaging service.

schemaType.description: Schema type used for the message.

cleanupPolicy.description: Topic clean up policy. For Kafka - `cleanup.policy` configuration.

id.description: Unique identifier that identifies this topic instance.

fullyQualifiedName.description: Name that uniquely identifies a topic in the format 'messagingServiceName.topicName'.

displayName.description: Display Name that identifies this topic. It could be title or label from the source services.

updatedAt.description: Last update time corresponding to the new version of the entity in Unix epoch time milliseconds.

service.description: Link to the messaging cluster/service where this topic is hosted in.

serviceType.description: Service type where this topic is hosted in.

partitions.description: Number of partitions into which the topic is divided.

schemaText.description: Schema used for message serialization. Optional as some topics may not have associated schemas.

cleanupPolicies.description: Topic clean up policies. For Kafka - `cleanup.policy` configuration.

retentionTime.description: Retention time in milliseconds. For Kafka - `retention.ms` configuration.

maximumMessageSize.description: Maximum message size in bytes. For Kafka - `max.message.bytes` configuration.

minimumInSyncReplicas.description: Minimum number replicas in sync to control durability. For Kafka - `min.insync.replicas` configuration.

retentionSize.description: Maximum size of a partition in bytes before old data is discarded. For Kafka - `retention.bytes` configuration.

href.description: Link to the resource corresponding to this entity.

changeDescription.description: Change that lead to this version of the entity.

deleted.description: When `true` indicates the entity has been soft deleted.
